Select line for selecting source clock for HSI. Data should be loaded as multibit. For example: if Clock source 0x5 should be selected then 0x555 should be configured to the register. Refer to AM273x clock spec for source clock reference

Select line for selecting source clock for CSI Rx Data should be loaded as multibit. For example: if Clock source 0x5 should be selected then 0x555 should be configured to the register. Refer to AM273x clock spec for source clock reference

Select line for selecting source clock for MCU Clkout Data should be loaded as multibit. For example: if Clock source 0x5 should be selected then 0x555 should be configured to the register. Refer to AM273x clock spec for source clock reference

Select line for selecting source clock for PMIC Clkout Data should be loaded as multibit. For example: if Clock source 0x5 should be selected then 0x555 should be configured to the register. Refer to AM273x clock spec for source clock reference

Select line for selecting source clock for OBS Clkout Data should be loaded as multibit. For example: if Clock source 0x5 should be selected then 0x555 should be configured to the register. Refer to AM273x clock spec for source clock reference

Select line for selecting source clock for TRC Clkout Data should be loaded as multibit. For example: if Clock source 0x5 should be selected then 0x555 should be configured to the register. Refer to AM273x clock spec for source clock reference
Divider value for HSI selected clock. Data should be loaded as multibit. For example: if divider value of 0x5 should be selected then 0x555 should be configured to the register.
Divider value for CSI Rx selected clock. Data should be loaded as multibit. For example: if divider value of 0x5 should be selected then 0x555 should be configured to the register.
Divider value for MCU Clkout selected clock. Data should be loaded as multibit. For example: if divider value of 0x5 should be selected then 0x555 should be configured to the register.

Divider value for OBS Clkout selected clock. Data should be loaded as multibit. For example: if divider value of 0x5 should be selected then 0x555 should be configured to the register.
Divider value for TRC Clkout selected clock. Data should be loaded as multibit. For example: if divider value of 0x5 should be selected then 0x555 should be configured to the register.
Clock gatring config for HSI. Data should be loaded as multibit. Write 3'b000 : Clock is ungated (multibit 000) Write 3'b111 : Clock is gated (multibit 111)
Clock gatring config for CSI Rx. Data should be loaded as multibit. Write 3'b000 : Clock is ungated (multibit 000) Write 3'b111 : Clock is gated (multibit 111)
Clock gatring config for MCU Clkout. Data should be loaded as multibit. Write 3'b000 : Clock is ungated (multibit 000) Write 3'b111 : Clock is gated (multibit 111)
Clock gatring config for PMIC Clkout Data should be loaded as multibit. Write 3'b000 : Clock is ungated (multibit 000) Write 3'b111 : Clock is gated (multibit 111)
Clock gatring config for OBS Clkout Data should be loaded as multibit. Write 3'b000 : Clock is ungated (multibit 000) Write 3'b111 : Clock is gated (multibit 111)
Clock gatring config for TRC Clkout Data should be loaded as multibit. Write 3'b000 : Clock is ungated (multibit 000) Write 3'b111 : Clock is gated (multibit 111)
Clock gatring config for DSP Subsystem System Clock Data should be loaded as multibit. Write 3'b000 : Clock is ungated (multibit 000) Write 3'b111 : Clock is gated (multibit 111)

Data should be loaded as multibit. Write 3'b000 to disable MSS Watchdog control on Warm reset Write 3'b111 enable MSS Watchdog to control Warm reset
Data should be loaded as multibit. Write 3'b000 to assert warm reset from SW Write 3'b111 to deassert warm reset from SW if this is the only source of warm reset
Bypass the Warm reset from Pad Input Data should be loaded as multibit. Write 3'b000 : Reset is not asserted by SW (multibit 000) Write 3'b111 : Reset is asserted by SW (multibit 111)

System Reset Cause register 5'b01001 - POR reset 5'b01010 - Warm reset due to MSS_WDT 5'b01100 - Warm reset due to TOP_RMC:WARM_RESET_CONFIG 5'b01000 - External Pad reset 5'b11000 - Warm reset due to HSM_WDT
Write pulse bit field: System Reset Cause register Clear
Reset control for DSP Subsystem Data should be loaded as multibit. Write 3'b000: Reset is not asserted by SW (multibit 000) Write 3'b111 : Reset is asserted by SW (multibit 111)

RS232 Bit Interval. 10 bit clock interval is selceted based on the value of MSS_CR5_CLK_SRC_SEL [9:0] used as RS232 Bit inteval when MSS_CR5_CLK_SRC_SEL = 0x0 [19:10] used as RS232 Bit inteval when MSS_CR5_CLK_SRC_SEL = 0x1 [29:20] used as RS232 Bit inteval when MSS_CR5_CLK_SRC_SEL = 0x2

LVDS Pad Control 0 Register. Below is the mapping for each bit. Refer the LVDS IO Spec for more details Bit 0 : Power Down Control for LVDS CLK Lane Bit 1: LOPWRA Control for i LVDS CLK Lane Bit 2: LOPWRB Control for LVDS CLK Lane Bit 3 : LPSEL Control for LVDS CLK Lane Bit 4 : SUB_LVDS_EN Control for LVDS CLK Lane Bit 5 : HIZ_DISABLE Control for LVDS CLK Lane Bit 6 : EXT_RES_EN Control for LVDS CLK Lane Bit 7 : Reserved Bit 8 : Power Down Control for LVDS DATA Lane 0 Bit 9: LOPWRA Control for i LVDS DATA Lane 0 Bit 10: LOPWRB Control for LVDS DATA Lane 0 Bit 11: LPSEL Control for LVDS DATA Lane 0 Bit 12: SUB_LVDS_EN Control for LVDS DATA Lane 0 Bit 13: HIZ_DISABLE Control for LVDS DATA Lane 0 Bit 14: EXT_RES_EN Control for LVDS DATA Lane 0 Bit 15: Reserved Bit 16 : Power Down Control for LVDS DATA Lane 1 Bit 17: LOPWRA Control for i LVDS DATA Lane 1 Bit 18: LOPWRB Control for LVDS DATA Lane 1 Bit 18: LPSEL Control for LVDS DATA Lane 1 Bit 20: SUB_LVDS_EN Control for LVDS DATA Lane 1 Bit 21: HIZ_DISABLE Control for LVDS DATA Lane 1 Bit 22: EXT_RES_EN Control for LVDS DATA Lane 1 Bit 23: Reserved Bit 24 : Power Down Control for LVDS DATA Lane 2 Bit 25: LOPWRA Control for i LVDS DATA Lane 2 Bit 26: LOPWRB Control for LVDS DATA Lane 2 Bit 27: LPSEL Control for LVDS DATA Lane 2 Bit 28: SUB_LVDS_EN Control for LVDS DATA Lane 2 Bit 29: HIZ_DISABLE Control for LVDS DATA Lane 2 Bit 30: EXT_RES_EN Control for LVDS DATA Lane 2 Bit 31: Reserved

LVDS Pad Control 1 Register. Below is the mapping for each bit. Refer the LVDS IO Spec for more details Bit 0 : Power Down Control for LVDS DATA Lane 0 Bit 1: LOPWRA Control for i LVDS DATA Lane 0 Bit 2: LOPWRB Control for LVDS DATA Lane 0 Bit 3: LPSEL Control for LVDS DATA Lane 0 Bit 4: SUB_LVDS_EN Control for LVDS DATA Lane 0 Bit 5: HIZ_DISABLE Control for LVDS DATA Lane 0 Bit 6: EXT_RES_EN Control for LVDS DATA Lane 0 Bit 7: Reserved Bit 8 : Power Down Control for LVDS FRME CLK Lane Bit 9 : LOPWRA Control for i LVDS FRAME CLK Lane Bit 10: LOPWRB Control for LVDS FRAME CLK Lane Bit 11 : LPSEL Control for LVDS FRAME CLK Lane Bit 12 : SUB_LVDS_EN Control for LVDS FRAME CLK Lane Bit 13 : HIZ_DISABLE Control for LVDS FRAME CLK Lane Bit 14 : EXT_RES_EN Control for LVDS FRAME CLK Lane Bit 15 -23: Reserved Bit 24 : Power Down Control for LVDS Bias cell Bit 25 : eEfuse Set Control for LVDS Bias cell
SW mapping for DMLED Execution Bit 0 : HSM CM4 Execution Bit 1 : HWA CM4 Execution Bit 2 : MSS CR5 Execution
SW mapping for DMLED Status Bit 0 : HSM CM4 Status Bit 1 : HWA CM4 Status Bit 2 : MSS CR5 Status

Force the RCCLK on when limp mode is detected 3'b000: The RCCLK will not be forced on when limp mode is detected (multibit 000) 3'b111 : The RCCLK will be forced on when limp mode is detected (multibit 111)
Enable MSS_CCCA Error to generate Limp mode 3'b000: MSS_CCCA Error will not generate Limp mode (multibit 000) 3'b111 : MSS_CCCA Error will generate Limp mode (multibit 111)
Enable MSS_DCCA Error to generate Limp mode 3'b000: MSS_DCCA Error will not generate Limp mode (multibit 000) 3'b111 : MSS_DCCA Error will generate Limp mode (multibit 111)
PMIC Clockout DCDC Maximum Frequency Threshold
PMIC Clockout DCDC Minimum Frequency Threshold
Reset control for PMIC DCDC Data should be loaded as multibit. Write 3'b000: Reset is not asserted by SW (multibit 000) Write 3'b111 : Reset is asserted by SW (multibit 111)
PMIC Clockout DCDC Freq Acc Enable
PMIC Clockout DCDC Clock Dither Enable
PMIC Clockout DCDC Clock Enable
PMIC Clockout DCDC Slope Config Value
Stop 32KHz RCOSC. Write 3'b111 to stop clock
ON/OFF control of the weak power switch digital. For functional mode it should be 1
ON/OFF control of the strong power switch digital. For functional mode it should be 1
Save/Restore control for Retention mode. For functional mode it should be 0
Save/Restore control for Isolation of output pins For functional mode it should be 0
Save/Restore control for Isolation of the Scanout pins. For functional mode it should be 0
Used to switch OFF the logic on VDDA. For functional mode it should be 0
FailSafe enable to trigger re-calibration in case CycleSlip occurs between REFCLK and FBCLK.
Controls Clock Spreading. SSC is not supported. Should be set to 0x0 to disable clock spreading.
Synchronously enables/disables CLKDCOLDO 0x0 : synchronously disables CLKDCOLDO 0x1 : synchronously enables CLKDCOLDO
Trim value for the PLL
Sets PLL to Idle mode 0x0 : When SYSRESET = 0 and TINITZ = 1 IDLE = 0 PLL will go to Active and Locked 0x1 : When SYSRESET = 0 and TINITZ = 1 IDLE = 1 PLL will go to Idle Bypass low powe

BYPASSACKZ is a special purpose input to the module. In general this input is expected to be tied to static low. For the output clocks of the module that do not have an internal bypass mux viz. CLKDCOLDO and CLKOUTLDO, a bypass mux could be implemented external to the module.

Standby retention control 0x0 : prepares ADPLLLJ for relock when out of retention by removing the gating on all internal clocks. 0x1 : prepares ADPLLLJ for retention by gating all the internal clocks.
CLKOUT enable or disable 0x0 : synchronously disables CLKOUT 0x1 : synchronously enables CLKOUT
Synchronously enables/disables CLKOUTLDO 0x0 : synchronously disables CLKOUTLDO 0x1 : synchronously enables CLKOUTLDO
Select CLKOUT source in bypass 0x0: When ADPLLLJ in bypass mode, CLKOUT = CLKINP/(N2+1) 0x1: When ADPLLLJ in bypass mode, CLKOUT = CLKINPULOW.
0 Asynchronous power down for CLKDCOLDO o/p.
M2 divider power down mode 0x0: Asynchronous power down for M2 divider 0x1 : M2 divider is functional
When in Lossclk/Stbyret 0x0 : Limp mode 0x1 : Stopmode

DCO Clock (DCOCLK = CLKINP * [M/(N+1)]) frequency range selector. 0x0: Reserved 0x2: HS2 : DCOCLK range is from 500 MHz to 1000 MHz 0x3: Reserved 0x4: HS1: DCOCLK range is from 1000 MHz to 2000 MHz 0x5: Reserved
Decides when FREQLOCK asserted 0x0: FREQLOCK asserted when DC frequency error less than 1% 0x1: FREQLOCK asserted when DC frequency error less than 2%
SSC Type
PLL core soft reset
M, N. SD and SELFREQDCO latch (active rise edge)
M2 and N2 latch (active rise edge)
Post-divider is REGM2
Pre-divider is REGN+1
Bypass divider is REGN2+1
Feedback Multiplier is REGM
Sigma-Delta Divider Should be set by s/w to provide optimum jitter performance. DPLL_SD_DIV = CEILING ([DPLL_MULT/(DPLL_DIV+1)] * CLKINP/ 250), where CLKINP is the input clock of the DPLL in MHz
Fractional part of the M divider.
Change Loop Bandwidth
Direction of Loop Bandwidth 0x0 : decrease BW 0x1 : increase BW
Controls frequency spread 0x0 : enables both side frequency spread about the programmed frequency. 0x1 : enables low frequency spread only
Exponent of the REFCLK divider to define the modulation frequency.
Mantissa of the REFCLK divider to define the modulation frequency
Integer part of Frequency Spread control
The fraction part of Frequency Spread control
Status of the weak power-switch 0x0 : indicates the/OFF status of the weak power-switch in digital to SOC. 0x1 : ndicates the ON status of the weak power-switch in digital to SOC.
Status of the strong power-switch 0x0 : indicates the/OFF status of the strong power-switch in digital to SOC. 0x1 : ndicates the ON status of the strong power-switch in digital to SOC.
1 indicates ADPLLLJ internal LDO is power down. VDDLDOOUT will be un-defined in this condition
Recalibration status flag. 1 ADPLLLJ requires recalibration
Recalibration status flag. 1 ADPLLLJ requires recalibration
Status on PHASELOCK output pin
Status on PHASELOCK output pin
Status on FREQLOCK output pin
Status of BYPASSACK output pin

Standby and retention status 0x0: indicates to SOC that all internal clocks in ADPLLLJ are active and it is starting the relock process. 0x1: indicates to SOC that all internal clocks in ADPLLLJ are gated and it is ready for retention.
Reference input loss
Indicates the enable/disable condition of CLKOUTEN 0x0 = CLKOUT gating completed 0x1 = CLKOUT enabling completed
ADPLL internal loop lock status
Acknowledge for change to M2 divider. Toggles from 1-0 or 0-1 (depending on current value) once CLKOUT frequency change has completed.
Spread Spectrum status 0x0 : Spread-spectrum Clocking is disabled on output clocks 0x1 : Spread-spectrum Clocking is enabled on output clocks
1 indicates jitter. After PHASELOCK is asserted high, the HIGHJITTER flag is asserted high if phase error between REFCLK and FBCLK greater than 24%.
Bypass status signal. 1 CLKOUT in bypass
LDO Power Down Ack
HSDIVIDER Bypass Ack
Tenable Div
LDO Power Down
HSDIVIDER Bypass
Power down for HSDIVIDER M4 divider and hence CLKOUT0 output 0h (R/W) = CLKOUT0 divider active 1h (R/W) = CLKOUT0 divider is powered down
HSDIVIDER CLKOUT0 status 0h (R) = The clock output is gated 1h (R) = The clock output is enabled
Control gating of HSDIVIDER CLKOUT0 0h (R/W) = Automatically gate this clock when there is no dependency for it 1h (R/W) = Force this clock to stay enabled even if there is no request
Toggle on this status bit after changing HSDIVIDER_CLKOUT0_DIV indicates that the change in divider value has taken effect
DPLL post-divider factor, M4, for internal clock generation. Divide values from 1 to 31. 0h (R/W) = Reserved
Power down for HSDIVIDER M5 divider and hence CLKOUT1 output 0h (R/W) = CLKOUT1 divider active 1h (R/W) = CLKOUT1 divider is powered down

Select line for selecting source clock for MSS Coretex R5 and System bus Clock. Data should be loaded as multibit. For example: if Clock source 0x5 should be selected then 0x555 should be configured to the register. Refer to AM273x clock spec for source clock reference
Divider value for Cortex R5 selected clock. Data should be loaded as multibit. For example: if divider value of 0x5 should be selected then 0x555 should be configured to the register.
Divider value for System Clock selected clock. Data should be loaded as multibit. For example: if divider value of 0x5 should be selected then 0x555 should be configured to the register.

Only for debug- Functionality not guaranteed Clock gating config for MSS Coretex R5. Data should be loaded as multibit. Write 3'b000 : Clock is ungated (multibit 000) Write 3'b111 : Clock is gated (multibit 111)

Only for debug- Functionality not guaranteed Clock gating config for System Clock Data should be loaded as multibit. Write 3'b000 : Clock is ungated (multibit 000) Write 3'b111 : Clock is gated (multibit 111)

OSC_CLKOUT Enable Enables the Slicer clock to drive the OSC_CLKOUT output buffer. It is recommended that this bit be activated as the last step after fields OSC_CLKOUT_DRV, OSC_CLKOUT_CLRZ_DIV, and OSC_CLKOUT_FREQ_SEL have been configured. 0 = Clock Disabled 1 = Clock Enabled 0x00 = Functional Reset
OSC_CLKOUT Frequency Selection Selects the output frequency as a division of the XTAL (or externally driven CLKP) frequency. x0 = XTAL/2 10 = XTAL/1 11 = XTAL/4 0x00 = Functional Reset

OSC_CLKOUT Divider ClearZ This active low signal permits the output frequency dividers to be properly cleared before enabling. 0 = All dividers cleared 1 = Normal divider function enabled 0x1 = Functional Reset
OSC_CLKOUT Drive This bit controls the drive strength of the OSC_CLKOUT buffer. 4'b0000 = No Test Output, Hi-Z Output Drive Ctrl = [4/9X][2/9X][2/9X][1/9X] 0xF = Functional Reset
Reserved Reads return 0x0 and writes have no effect. 0x0 = Functional Reset

XTAL Detect Enable This bit connects a pullup and sense circuitry to CLKM to detect the presence or absence of a crystal. This operation will conflict with oscillator functionality, so this bit must be asserted only when the oscillator is disabled (CTRL_CLKTOP_REG1 bit 2 must be "0"). After asserted, the internal XTAL_SENSE signal will reflect a "1" if a crystal is present (CLKM sees a high impedance) or "0" if CLKM is tied to ground. After the sense operation is detected, this bit must be cleared before the oscillator will function properly if enabled. 0 = Normal operation (pullup and sense circuitry are disconnected from CLKM, XTAL_SENSE outputs "1") 1 = XTAL sense function enabled (pullup and sense circuitry connected to CLKM, output of XTAL_SENSE reads "1" if high impedance, "0" if CLKM is tied to ground) 0x0 = Functional Reset
Slicer DC-Coupled Mode 0 = Normal operation (AC-couple CLKP to internal slicer) 1 = DC-couple CLKP to internal slicer to CLKP 0x0 = Functional Reset

Slicer High-power Mode This bit bypasses the input clock slicer current-starving/filtering circuitry to increase gain and reduce device phase-noise at the expense of power and reduced supply noise rejection. This permits the use of a high-speed external test clock (660MHz max). 0 = Normal operation (current-limiting present) 1 = High-power/high-speed test mode 0x0 = Functional Reset

Bias Fast-charge Enable (Active Low) This bit bypasses the RC filtering on the XOSC/SLICER Bias to permit more rapid power-up. 0 = Bias fast-charge 1 = Normal operation (filtering present) 0x1 = Functional Reset
